English Translations: above, over (sometimes used as a synonym for *ʿalā*, ‘on’.)
(f.) spring (When عَيْنٌ has the sense of ‘eye’, its Qurʾānic plural is أَعْيُنٌ)
to send forward, to bring forward
to deny, give the lie to
to deny, not to believe in, to be an unbeliever
to become clear, be made clear
to be secure; to trust in
to let enjoy; make provision for
to be able (This verb—exceptionally—sometimes drops the *tāʾ* of the 10ᵗʰ form prefix, producing *isṭāʿa, yasṭīʿ*, and *tasṭiʿ*.)
to die (Though *māta* has a *wāw* as its middle radical, the contracted forms of the Perfect normally have a *kasra: mittu* etc.)
to turn away; to take on oneself
to protect oneself, to be god-fearing
Note the construction *kafā bi-llāhi ḥasīban* 'there is sufficiency in God as a reckoner' i.e. 'God is sufficient as a reckoner'. There are further examples in sentences 22 and 23 below.
to fear, be in awe of
to become; be in the morning
to cause to fall, bring down
to deny, disapprove; not to know
